Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which Democrats are trying to stop disaster relief aid from going to several states.
Falters at times: The claim falters by falsely accusing Democrats of trying to stop disaster relief aid, when in reality both parties support it but have pushed different versions of the legislation.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific evidence or examples to back up the accusation against Democrats.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Democrats are solely responsible for the delay in getting an appropriations bill passed for disaster relief aid.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that both parties have different versions of the legislation and are working towards reaching a compromise.
